main event: Blinking lights appearing to be about the size of the planet Venus, following an erratic course for over half an hour were observed in Las Vegas, Nevada on January 23, 1959.
interesting points: The object was circular, very bright, about the size of a bowling ball, and several feet above the ground.
The light was blinking at irregular intervals, but steady when stationary.
The object was observed for a very brief period of 12 to 15 minutes.
The object appeared to follow the observer's car and did not vary from a straight line of flight.
The observer remained in the car and proceeded to leave the area at a speed of 50 to 60 miles per hour.
sighted object: Blinking lights appearing to be about the size of the planet Venus
